Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: AHEAD is a voluntary state total cost of care model with a goal of improving the total health of a participating state’s population, reducing disparities in health care outcomes, and limiting the growth of health care costs.
Keywords: Accountable Care, Multi-Payer aligment, state selection, eligibility, All-Payer, health equity, hospital global budgets, primary care, AHEAD

Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: TMaH focuses on improving maternal health outcomes for Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) enrollees. TMaH supports the development of a whole-person approach to pregnancy while reducing access and treatment disparities.
Keywords: State & Community-Based Models, Pregnancy, maternal health, maternity, childbirth, delivery, postpartum care, mothers, babies, Medicaid, Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP), equity, disparities, social needs, newborns

Number of Participants: Practice participants will be determined once the NOFO period has ended – up to eight states are eligible for participation
Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: IBH is a voluntary state model for Medicare/Medicaid populations with mental health conditions and/or substance use disorders. IBH aims to improve behavioral/physical health outcomes and overall quality of care for this population.
Keywords: Innovation in Behavioral Health (IBH) Model, IBH Model, Behavioral health, substance use disorders, SUD, Opioid Use Disorder, OUD, Medicaid

Model Name: Cell and Gene Therapy (CGT) Access Model
Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: The CGT Access Model is a voluntary model for states and manufacturers that tests whether a CMS-led approach to developing and administering outcomes-based agreements for cell and gene therapies improves access to innovative treatment.
Keywords: Cell and Gene Therapy (CGT) Access Model, Sickle Cell Disease, Medicaid Drug Rebate Program

Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: The ACO Primary Care Flex Model is a voluntary model focused on improving funding and other resources to support primary care delivery in the Medicare Shared Savings Program.
Keywords: Accountable Care Organizations, ACOs, Primary Care, ACO PC Flex Model, ACO Primary Care Flex Model

Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: TEAM is a proposed five-year mandatory episode-based alternative payment model that would incentivize coordination between care providers during a surgery as well as the services provided during the 30 days that follow.
Keywords: Transforming Episode Accountability Model (TEAM), healthcare innovation, innovation models, episode-based, mandatory models, care coordination, surgical and post-surgical care, acute care

Authority: Section 1115A of the Social Security Act
Description: The Increasing Organ Transplant Model is a proposed mandatory model that aims to increase access to life-saving transplants for patients living with kidney disease.
Keywords: Increasing Organ Transplant Access (IOTA) Model, Organs, Transplants, proposed, mandatory model,  life-saving transplants, patients, chronnic kidney disease (CKD)
